channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Workers see dramatic fall in share of global income: UN
item.description: The UN's International Labour Organization states that the global labour income share has fallen by 1.6% since 2004, causing a $2.4 trillion annual shortfall for workers. This decline, intensified by the Covid-19 pandemic, highlights rising inequality and underscores the need for policies to ensure fair economic distribution.

item.title: Ship scheduled for world cruise in May has been stranded in Belfast for past three months
item.description: About 200 passengers are stranded in Belfast, awaiting the departure of the Villa Vie Residences' Odyssey for a three-year world cruise. The ship, built in 1993 and offline since 2020, needs repairs to its rudder shafts, steelwork, and engine. Passengers can spend their days on board but must leave each evening.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Will release UFO footage, Jeffrey Epstein's documents if elected': Trump claims
item.description: Donald Trump has pledged to release UFO footage and Jeffrey Epstein's documents if he wins the presidential election. He also intends to form a commission on John F. Kennedy's assassination and make related documents public early in his term. Trump clarified he had no involvement with Epstein despite their acquaintance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran summons Australian ambassador over Instagram post supporting LGBTQIA+ rights
item.description: Iran summoned Australia's ambassador following an Instagram post by the Australian embassy in Tehran celebrating 'Wear It Purple Day' for LGBTQIA+ youth. Iran criticized the post as promoting homosexuality and contrary to Islamic traditions, while Australia defended its stance on human rights. The post is still available on the embassy's Instagram page.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Do not neglect us': Hamas releases video of slain Israeli hostage calling for help
item.description: Hamas released a video showing Ori Danino, one of six hostages found executed in Rafah. In the video, Danino describes harsh living conditions and criticizes Israeli leadership for failed rescue attempts. He urges Israelis to continue efforts to save the hostages and ends with a plea, "People of Israel: Do not neglect us."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Long Island man killed by girlfriend's jealous ex-husband remembered as 'hero' at funeral
item.description: Kenneth Pohlman, a 53-year-old Long Island resident and father of three, was laid to rest after being fatally shot while defending his girlfriend from her ex-husband in St. James. Mourners remembered him for his dedication as a father and sports enthusiast. Daniel Coppola, who had shown abusive behavior towards his ex-wife Kelly Coppola, has been arrested and confessed to the killings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Henry? World's oldest crocodile, who has fathered 10,000 babies with six partners
item.description: Henry, a massive Nile crocodile weighing 700 kg and measuring 16 feet, is now officially the world's oldest crocodile at age 123. Residing at Crocworld Conservation Centre in South Africa, he has fathered over 10,000 offspring. Captured in Botswana in 1903 for preying on children, Henry's life is now far removed from his violent past.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Thousands of Rohingya flee to Bangladesh from violence in Myanmar, official says
item.description: Around 8,000 Rohingya Muslims have crossed into Bangladesh recently, fleeing escalating violence in Myanmar's Rakhine state. Bangladeshi officials report that the country is already overburdened with refugees and unable to accommodate more. The government plans urgent discussions on the crisis and urges international action against ongoing violence in Myanmar.

item.title: Rise of Germany's far-right AfD stokes fears at concentration camp site
item.description: The historian overseeing Germany's Buchenwald concentration camp memorial is alarmed by rising threats following the far-right AfD's electoral success in Thuringia. He anticipates increased anti-immigration sentiments and potential budget cuts for the memorial, which honors more than 56,000 victims of Nazi crimes.

item.title: Australian government to enact new regulations after Air Traffic Controller found asleep
item.description: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau has enacted new regulations after an air traffic controller was discovered asleep during a shift at Brisbane's Air Traffic Services Centre on December 9, 2022. An investigation revealed significant issues in fatigue management practices. In response, Airservices Australia has increased staffing and updated its fatigue assessment tool to prevent future incidents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vengeful Thai trans woman scams over 70 Japanese men for over a decade
item.description: A Thai transgender woman named Amy defrauded over 70 Japanese men for nearly 30 million baht over 13 years. After being abandoned by her Japanese boyfriend, she started taking revenge on Japanese men. She posed as a tourist from Taiwan or Hong Kong to gain sympathy and manipulate men. She was arrested in Bangkok on August 4.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan government bars public servants from using social media without permission
item.description: The Pakistan government has restricted all government employees from using social media without prior permission to prevent the leakage of official information. Employees are prohibited from sharing opinions or documents that could affect the government's reputation, policy, or national sovereignty. Institutions are required to monitor social media for any objectionable content.

item.title: Is Prince Harry returning to royal duties? Duke of Sussex clarifies
item.description: Prince Harry appears uninterested in resuming royal duties and is settled in California with good friends. Despite rumors of his return, he seeks advice from old acquaintances as his current situation in the US isn't favorable. He plans a New York trip for charity work, aligning with the UN General Assembly’s High-level Week.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump to plead not guilty in revised 2020 election indictment charges
item.description: Donald Trump will plead not guilty to criminal charges alleging he tried to overturn his 2020 election defeat. His legal team submitted a filing allowing them to enter the plea on his behalf. Despite some modifications in the indictment, the charges remain unchanged, and a court hearing is set for Thursday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea allegedly executes 30 government officials for flood failures
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is reported to have executed at least 30 officials for their failure to prevent devastating summer floods that killed thousands. The North Korean Central News Agency confirmed Kim's orders for strict punishment. Despite offers of aid from neighboring countries, North Korea has refused assistance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why China keeps ramming Philippine ships and where that’s headed
item.description: Tensions in the South China Sea have escalated as China's coast guard clashes with Philippine vessels. The conflict, centered around the Sabina Shoal, has drawn global attention and involves multiple Asian countries. The US, bound by a defense treaty with the Philippines, could be dragged into a direct conflict with China.

item.title: 'Wasteful spending': Prince Harry, Meghan Markle's Colombia tour cost revealed
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's four-day visit to Colombia cost the country nearly £45,000, covering security and internal transportation. The couple paid for their own flights and accommodation. The total expenditure, which was Col$244,245,305 (£44,725.14), covered various aspects of the trip, including security and internal transportation throughout the trip. The total cost encompassed an eight-day period from August 12 to 19.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman starts two wildfires to flirt with firefighters
item.description: A woman from Tripoli, Greece, has been convicted for intentionally setting two wildfires to flirt with firefighters. She received a three-year suspended prison sentence and a €1,000 fine. The fire department quickly controlled the blazes, which is critical given the severe wildfire outbreaks in Greece during August 2024.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Female teacher shot dead in Pakistan for refusing marriage proposal
item.description: A female teacher, aged 40, was fatally shot in front of her father after declining a marriage proposal in Buner, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The suspect escaped. This tragic event highlights an increasing crime trend in Pakistan, including recent 'honour' killings where women were murdered for marrying against their families' wishes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Doesn’t give a s**t about them': Donald Trump's nephew Fred Trump blasts uncle over military disrespect
item.description: Fred Trump III, nephew of former US President Donald Trump, criticized his uncle on MSNBC's "Deadline: White House" for lacking empathy towards the military. He highlighted Trump's past remarks about late Senator John McCain and suggested that Trump's indifference to the armed forces is genuine and deeply ingrained, driven by self-interest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
